column5: Been down here for a couple of weeks and have caught a bunch of fish but haven't taken any pictures until today. Took one of the Pompano I brought home for tonight's dinner.
Beautiful fish, get the beer batter ready,  bring on some more pics
Whats the meat like Dave?  Nice looking fish.
Meat is light and white. Pretty tasty too. BBQ'd and served with beans and mac/cheese.
I just ate a nice fresh white fish and fries, That just made me hungry again. You can go wrong with fish from the sea.
Pompano are cool fish, how do they fight?

AKA Pomfret, one of the best tasting salt water fish IMO, no scales to clean, just remove guts, score the skin a few places, rub with your favorite spices, garlic & lime juice, shallow fry and serve hot with home made salsa & chips
Pompano are cool fish, how do they fight?  Like a really big sunfish!!!
Went a little lite on the spice there Dave LOL,    baked beans, mac and cheese, and lots of spice, spells gassy methane mushroom cloud
My oldman loves eating those things.... and whitings and mackerel, and everything else.
The meat on those fish are awesome. We eat em a lot at home. Steamed with onions, tomato,  salt and pepper is another way of cooking it. They are great on the BBQ.
Sweet - I love freshwater fishing but you can't argue that saltwater fish out-fight freshwater fish 10-1!  They taste pretty awesome to!
Got out in the Yak for  few hours with my buddy Brian this morning. The paddling was good, weather was awesome and a few reds were caught.
Nice scenery, and a great looking fish!
awesome stuff .... that bbq picture really makes you hungry  once you get back up north will you be starting work on the cabin ?

awesome stuff .... that bbq picture really makes you hungry  once you get back up north will you be starting work on the cabin ?  Yeah, that's the plan. Move supplies to the site before ice out. Don't know what I'll get done this year. Starting with the dock and then hopefully the foundation. Depends how much $$$$ I go through.
